page.title: 07INCE BENET-INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: Ince benet is situated in the old kitchen garden of Ince Blundell Hall. Three monks began the project in an attempt to create a simple life of work and prayer. The building itself is an unusual design, built mainly from materials left over from other buiding projects and other donations. Only one priest,Father Tom, now remains. He is responsible for most of the building work. He is joined from time to time by other individuals and groups looking for a quiet time of contemplation and prayer. Ince Benet is largely self-sufficient. Father Tom is an expert bookbinder and earns enough for daily needs. He grow most of his own fruit and vegetables.
